name: brown butter earl grey cookies
directions: preheat oven to 350â„‰. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
in a light coloured saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat, stirring constantly.
once melted, the butter will foam and sizzle. continue stirring for 5-7 minutes until it turns golden brown and smells nutty.
add in the ground earl grey and allow the tea to steep in the butter for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
pour into a heatproof bowl and whisk in the brown sugar and granulated sugar.
add egg and vanilla and mix.
in a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
add the dry ingredients and fold until only some flour is visible.
add chocolate chips and fold until no more flour is visible.
scoop dough onto the baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.
allow to cool on the pan for at least 5 minutes before moving.
notes: browning the butter and steeping the tea is the secret to the depth of flavor.
